article.headline: LSU 87, Northwestern St. 78
article.story: BATON ROUGE, La. -- Freshmen Ralston Turner and Andre Stringer each scored 21 points as LSU defeated Northwestern State 87-78 in the opener for both teams Friday night. Turner made 6 of his 12 shots from the field, including 3 of 6 on 3-pointers. Stringer, who came off the bench, knocked down four 3-pointers and was 7 of 10 at the foul line. Aaron Dotson scored a career-high 17 points, while Malcolm White added 12 for LSU. Will Pratt equaled his career-high with 29 points for the Demons. After a 25-5 run put Northwestern State ahead 38-34 with 3:01 until halftime, the Tigers knocked down 3-pointers on their next three possessions. A 3-pointer by Turner gave the Tigers the lead for good in the second half. Following a field goal by Louis Ellis, Stringer scored seven consecutive points on a 3-pointer, a field goal and two free throws. That run put LSU on top 63-55 with 11:53 to play.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
